user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ahc_main:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
ahc_main (void *cls,
          struct MHD_Connection *connection,
          const char *url,
          const char *method,
          const char *version,
          const char *upload_data, size_t *upload_data_size,
          void **req_cls)
{
  static int already_called_marker;
  size_t url_len;
  (void) cls;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) version;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if ((0 != strcmp (method, MHD_HTTP_METHOD_GET))
      && (0 != strcmp (method, MHD_HTTP_METHOD_HEAD)))
    return reply_with_method_not_supported (connection);

  if (0 != *upload_data_size)
    return MHD_NO; /* No upload expected for GET or HEAD */

  if (&already_called_marker != *req_cls)
  { /* Called for the first time, request not fully read yet */
    *req_cls = &already_called_marker;
    /* Wait for complete request */
    return MHD_YES;
  }

  if (0 == strcmp (url, "/"))
    return reply_with_main_page (connection);

  url_len = strlen (url);

  if ((strlen (SEC_AREA1_URL) <= url_len)
      && (0 == memcmp (url, SEC_AREA1_URL, strlen (SEC_AREA1_URL))))
    return handle_sec_areas_req (connection, url, 1); /* The requested URL is within SEC_AREA1_URL */

  if ((strlen (SEC_AREA2_URL) <= url_len)
      && (0 == memcmp (url, SEC_AREA2_URL, strlen (SEC_AREA2_URL))))
    return handle_sec_areas_req (connection, url, 2); /* The requested URL is within SEC_AREA2_URL */

  return reply_with_page_not_found (connection);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function ahc_main:
#define MHD_HTTP_METHOD_GET "GET"
...
#define MHD_HTTP_METHOD_HEAD "HEAD"
...
#define SEC_AREA1_URL "/secret_page/"
...
#define SEC_AREA2_URL "/super_secret_page/"
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other pointer uses in the function do not need investigation for Rule 8.13: the character-pointer parameters (url, method, version, upload_data) are already const-qualified; string-literal macros (MHD_HTTP_METHOD_GET/HEAD, SEC_AREA1_URL, SEC_AREA2_URL) are used only as read-only data with strcmp/memcmp, which accept const pointers; the size_t *upload_data_size is an API output/communication parameter (expected to be writable by the caller/library) so it cannot generally be made const; the connection pointer is part of the external MHD API and may represent a mutable object (so it is not safe to mark it const without checking the API contract). Therefore only the listed fragments are potential candidates to check whether pointer types could be const-qualified or whether the object pointed-to could/should be const.
